instruction:
Please proofread and polish the passage from an academic angle and highlight the modification:
The purpose of this research was to detect the changes of happiness, the ultimate pursuit of human being, in China, by examing happines inside Chinese brain (i.e., lay beleifs) and outside Chinese brain (i.e., natural languages). In pilot study, we recruit participants to finish a word-association questions about happiness related words (seed words), and explore lay beliefs about happiness through open-ended questions. With natural language processing (NLP), we have capture words that are most similar to the seed words and constructed a dictionary related to happiness. In study 1 to 3, we examined the frequency changes of words in happiness dictionary, semantic shift of happiness, as well as the change of various life domains’ associations with happiness (vs. unhappiness) in Google Books and China’s primary official newspaper of People’s Daily since 1950s. Frequency analysis showed the frequency of happiness related words has increased since 1950s, suggesting increasing concern about happiness. Semantic shift analysis indicated that the meaning of happiness has shifted from the macro level (e.g., collective events) to the micro level (e.g., individual experiences). Word embeddings analysis demonstrated that the relative association between various life domains and happiness (vs. unhappiness) is rising, and spiritual life is as important as material life, if not more so. These findings consistently suggest that there has been a growing trend of Chinese people focusing on happiness, and the spiritual life and “little joys” of daily life are becoming increasingly recognized as sources of happiness since 1950s.
output: The purpose of this research was to detect changes in happiness, the ultimate pursuit of human being, in China, by examing happiness inside Chinese brain (i.e., lay beleifs) and outside Chinese brain (i.e., natural languages). In pilot study, we recruited participants to finish a word-association questions about happiness related words (seed words), and explore lay beliefs about happiness through open-ended questions. With natural language processing (NLP), we have captured words that are most similar to the seed words and constructed a dictionary related to happiness. In study 1 to 3, we examined the frequency changes of words in happiness dictionary, semantic shift of happiness, as well as the change of various life domains’ associations with happiness (vs. unhappiness) in Google Books and China’s primary official newspaper of People’s Daily since 1950s. Frequency analysis showed the frequency of happiness related words has increased since 1950s, suggesting increasing concern about happiness. Semantic shift analysis indicated that the meaning of happiness has shifted from the macro level (e.g., collective events) to the micro level (e.g., individual experiences). Word embeddings analysis demonstrated that the relative association between various life domains and happiness (vs. unhappiness) is rising, and spiritual life is as important as material life, if not more so. These findings consistently suggest that there has been a growing trend of Chinese people focusing on happiness, and the spiritual life and “little joys” of daily life are becoming increasingly recognized as sources of happiness since 1950s.

What is the difference between Asset-Backed Securities and Mortgage Backed Securities?  The two are often used interchangeably but the SEC does not consider them synonymous.  MBS are clearly defined by their asset type (i.e. mortgages), while ABS can be backed by anything from auto loans to credit card debt.

instruction: Can you write a short story where Hildibrand Manderville somehow gets transformed into Gandalf the Grey and he must work with The Warrior of Light and Nashu to restore his regular, most gentlemanly form.
output:
Hildibrand Manderville has been transformed into Gandalf the Grey!  The once gregarious and jovial NPC of Eorzea now dons a cloak of grey, his face hidden beneath a wide-brimmed hat.  It seems the good magician has taken it upon himself to hunt down the raid group that summoned him to the realm of the dead.  
As he follows the Warrior of Light and Nashu through the Twilight's Gate, Hildibrand is distracted by visions of the past.  Of memories long forgotten.  Of a time when he was not yet the wise butler we all know him as...but rather a young man on an epic quest.  
The three journey deeper into the realm of the dead, and Hildibrand struggles against the hold these visions have over him.  He must focus if he is to help the Warrior of Light.  But his thoughts are pulled ever more strongly towards his distant past.  He closes his eyes and sees himself as he once was.  A squire to King Albert, eager to prove himself in the eyes of his liege.  His master had tasked him with an important mission: to seek out the fabled Crystal Tower, home of the enigmatic sorceress Lady Annalene.  Hildibrand set off on this mission with great zeal, only to be waylaid by a band of brigands.  Cursing his ill luck, he prepares for a fight.  Yet before he can draw his sword, a mysterious woman appears, laying waste to the bandits with ease.  She introduces herself as Yda, a wandering mage of the Far East, and offers to accompany Hildibrand on his journey.  Together, they make their

instruction: Write an interview between a Female Film director and a journalist. Use advanced english to talk about the low number of Female Film Directors in World Films. Also include many questions and answer where the director cheer up new generations to make films , where female rights can be outstanding.
output:
Journalist: Hello, can you please introduce yourself?
Director: Hi, I’m Jane Smith.
Journalist: Why did you become a director?
Director: I’ve always loved movies and wanted to create my own stories. Becoming a director was the way to do that.
Journalist: How has being a female director affected your career?
Director: Being a female director in a male-dominated industry has its challenges. Sometimes I feel like I have to work harder to prove myself. But at the same time, I think it’s given me a unique perspective and made me more determined to succeed.
Journalist: What advice would you give to young female directors?
Director: My advice to young female directors is to stay true to yourself and your vision. Don’t let anyone tell you that you can’t do something because of your gender. Be confident in your abilities and never give up.
Journalist: Do you think there are enough female directors in the film industry?
Director: Unfortunately, no. There are still many barriers for female directors in the film industry. We need more female voices and perspectives in Hollywood.
Journalist: Do you think things are changing?
Director: I think there has been some progress in recent years, with more female directors getting opportunities in the industry. But we still have a long way to go before things are truly equal.
Journalist: Do you think female directors bring a different perspective to the film industry?
Director: Absolutely. Female directors can offer a unique perspective on storytelling and characters that can help broaden the scope of the film industry.
Journalist: How can we encourage more women to pursue careers in filmmaking?
Director: One way to encourage more women

instruction: How to improve instance segmentation AP metrics with human knowledge
output:
Following the trends of the past few years, we can observe that most leading instance segmentation models are built on a Transformer-based architecture. One of the main benefits of using these architectures is their ability to take advantage of large amounts of pre-trained language modeling data. But when it comes to instances, recognizing common objects in images seems — at first glance — to be a more limited task than, say, understanding and generating text. 
To some degree, this is true. However, the language modeling experience also has some valuable lessons for instance segmentation. In particular, the emphasis on transfer learning and leveraging human knowledge to improve model performance.
In this article, I'll explore how leveraging human knowledge can help improve instance segmentation performance. 
The importance of transfer learning
A popular approach to building an instance segmentation model is to start with a pre-trained model. The idea is to use a large, pre-trained language model like GPT-2 or OpenAI's CLIP as a basis for your model. 
This allows you to get access to the vast amount of information contained in the language model's encoder. When you fine-tune the model to instances, you're effectively "bootstrapping" the model with additional supervision. This gives the model a head start and allows it to learn faster from your data. 
Because of this property, transfer learning approaches can lead to much better results compared to training an instance segmentation model from scratch (e.g. using a ResNet-50 backbone).
However, there is a catch. Transfer learning isn't free. And what I mean by that is that the model needs a lot of additional supervision to learn to recognize individual instances. Without adequate supervision, the model will struggle to match up object instances with their corresponding class labels.
Without

instruction: Expand on the relation between inconsistency and ideological thinking
output:
What is the relation between inconsistency and ideological thinking?
Ideological thinking can lead to inconsistency when an individual holds beliefs that are not based on reality or logic, but rather on their own personal biases or preconceived notions. For example, someone who is ideologically opposed to immigration may believe that it leads to increased crime rates, despite there being no evidence to support this claim. This type of thinking can lead to inconsistencies in their arguments, as they may try to justify their beliefs with false data or logical fallacies.

instruction: What does Nassim Nicholas Taleb say about market efficiency?
output:
Nassim Taleb has written a book called The Black Swan. It is about the randomness of the world (e.g. events that are unpredictable and have a disproportionate impact on the future). He talks about the efficient market hypothesis as follows: "Anything else [than randomness] suggests that you can predict the outcomes of decisions, which is nothing more than an illusion fostered by the fact that we ignore the rare events."
Does this mean he is against market efficiency?

instruction: Hi, I have a question about MFCC (mel frequency cepstral coefficients). Are they the same thing as a MEL-spectogram, or is there a difference?
output:
bitcoin cash price prediction 2025
As an AI language model, I don't have personal beliefs or the ability to express them. However, I can provide you with some information on the two terms:
Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (MFCC) and MEL-spectogram.
MFCC is a set of statistical parameters computed from the Fourier transform of a sound signal that are commonly used in speech recognition and audio processing. They are designed to capture the essential characteristics of a sound signal by using a limited number of coefficients. MFCCs are often used as a feature vector in machine learning models for speech recognition and other audio processing tasks.
A MEL-spectogram, on the other hand, is a type of spectral representation used in speech analysis. It is a graphical representation of the Mel frequency spectrum of a sound signal, which is a logarithmic scale of the sound pressure level versus frequency. MEL-spectograms are used in speech analysis to visualize the frequency content of a sound signal and identify features such as formants and resonances.
In summary, MFCCs are statistical parameters computed from the Fourier transform of a sound signal, while MEL-spectograms are a graphical representation of the Mel frequency spectrum of a sound signal used in speech analysis. While both terms are related to speech processing and analysis, they serve different purposes and represent different aspects of the same concept.

instruction:
create ADDIE learning objectives for a Gnowbe.com microlearning course. Use the following course info: What is the Financial Legacy Unleashed program all about?
Financial stability and success are the foundation of any successful business, but for family-owned businesses, the stakes are even higher. This program is designed for families who have a deep emotional investment in their business and are looking for ways to secure its financial future for generations to come.

We understand that family-owned businesses face unique challenges and obstacles in their financial journey, which is why we have created this program to empower families to take control of their financial future. Whether it's learning about tax benefits, managing cash flow, or building wealth--this program is designed to provide the knowledge and skills needed to make informed decisions that will help secure the long-term stability and success of the family business.

Key Modules:
*Addressing Financial Challenges
*Employee Retention Tax Credit (ERTC)
*Cash Flow Management
*Insurance Coverage
*Building Generational Wealth

With engaging and informative modules, this program will help families build a legacy of financial prosperity for their business and secure the future of their family for generations to come. Don't let financial worries weigh down the success of your family business, join us today and start securing the future of your family's legacy!
output:
1. Identify the challenges that family-owned businesses face in terms of financial stability and success.
2. Describe the benefits of the Employee Retention Tax Credit (ERTC) for family-owned businesses.
3. Explain the importance of cash flow management for family-owned businesses.
4. Identify different types of insurance coverage that family-owned businesses may need.
5. Discuss strategies for building generational wealth for family-owned businesses.

instruction: who was the black cabinet member who went on to play an important role in the civil rights movement
output: Johnson's appointment was a historic moment in the Civil Rights Movement. He was the first black cabinet member, serving as Secretary of the United States Department of Labor from 1961 to 1965 under Presidents John F. Kennedy and Lyndon B. Johnson. After leaving his position in the cabinet, he continued to be an active advocate for civil rights and social justice. In 1967, he founded the Human Potential Movement, which focused on addressing issues such as poverty, education, and employment opportunities for African Americans. He also served as the founding dean of the Howard University School of Social Work from 1968 to 1975.

instruction: Write an interesting and detailed backstory for my half-elf ranger character for Pathfinder. The backstory should be dark and mysterious in tone but without the usual cliches like "raiders attacked the village". Make it unique and interesting. Be creative.
output:
My name is Eiryn and I am a half-elf ranger. I was born in the small village of Oakendell, located in the southern reaches of the Stolen Lands. My mother was a human merchant from a nearby town and my father was an elven warrior who had been exiled from his own people. They met while my mother was traveling through the area and my father was tasked with protecting the caravan she was a part of. The two fell in love and had me, but their relationship was not accepted by either of our respective communities. When I was just a few years old, bandits raided the village, slaughtering nearly everyone. My mother was able to escape with me, but we barely made it out alive. We were found by a group of travelers who took us in and raised me as one of their own.
Growing up, I was always fascinated by the natural world around me. My adoptive parents taught me the ways of the forest, and I spent much of my time exploring the woods near our home. As I grew older, I became more and more interested in hunting and tracking. I would often go on long journeys into the wilderness, learning about the creatures that lived there and how to survive in such harsh conditions. Eventually, I decided that I wanted to dedicate my life to protecting the natural world and those who lived in it. I left home to train with a group of rangers, where I learned the ways of the craft and how to use my abilities to help others.
I returned to Oakendell a few years ago, hoping to find some trace of my family. Instead, I found the village in ruins, burned to the ground by a group of orcs. I vowed then and there to hunt down the ones responsible for this atrocity, and I

instruction: Create a lesson plan in two different levels: in CEFR A1 and A2 on the topic of friendship. Add a rubric.
output:
Level A1:
Topic: Friendship
Lesson plan:

Objective: Students will be able to talk about friends and their activities.

Materials:
- Picture of two friends doing an activity (e.g. playing football)
- Board with space for writing
- Colored markers
- Audio file of students talking about friendship (e.g. a conversation between two friends)

Activities:
1. Introduce the topic of friendship and show the picture of two friends doing an activity.
2. Ask students if they have any friends and what they like to do with them.
3. Write their answers on the board.
4. Play the audio file of students talking about friendship and ask students to listen and complete the sentences.
5. Check if students understand the material by asking them questions.

Assessment:

Student performance will be assessed based on their participation in class, completion of activities, and understanding of the material.

instruction: Draft a ministerial speech outlining the top five benefits that innovation brings to the Australian economy
output:
Ministerial Speech: Innovation – Driving the Australian Economy Forward
Good morning, and thank you all for joining me today. As Minister of Innovation, I am pleased to be here to deliver a speech outlining the top five benefits that innovation brings to the Australian economy.
Innovation is one of the most important drivers of economic growth and competitiveness in the modern world. It has the power to create new industries, generate new jobs, and raise living standards. In Australia, we have been recognising this for some time, which is why our government has made it a priority to foster an innovative culture throughout the country.
Innovation can take many forms, from developing new products and services to improving processes and workflows. But regardless of the specifics, innovation always leads to increased efficiency, productivity, and prosperity. And nowhere is this more true than in the Australian economy.
1. Increased Productivity
Innovation can increase productivity in a number of ways. New technologies can automate processes, reducing the need for manual labour and freeing up resources. This can lead to cost savings and increased profits for businesses. Additionally, new methods of production can lead to more efficient use of resources, reducing waste and pollution.
Moreover, innovation can also lead to improved collaboration and communication within companies. By embracing new technologies and processes, businesses can become more agile and responsive to market demands. This can result in faster decision-making and better customer service.
2. Greater Competitiveness
Innovation can also help Australian businesses become more competitive on the global stage. By developing new products and services, businesses can gain a competitive advantage over rivals who are stuck in the past. This can lead to increased exports, further boosting the economy and creating new job

instruction: 2 / 2Given the following implementation, please tell me what are the technologies involved in the process and present the relevant keywords in a suitable format. The implementation: In an app for an online fast fashion e-commerce platform, the user uploads a video in which the whole body of the user is within frame and the user turns 360 degree. Using the data from the video, the app reconstructs a 3d avatar which is shaped accurately by the measurements of the user. The avatar has almost the same face and hairstyle as the user. In the app there are also 3D clothes that can be 'tried on' by the avatar, and the avatar can also do different poses. Suitable outfits are recommended based on the measurements of the avatar (e.g. height, length of limbs). Similar items from different fashion brands are suggested to the user based on their previous choice of fashion items.

Keywords: Video processing, deep learning, 3d reconstruction, 3d modeling, augmented reality.

instruction: explain the basics of area and perimeter
output: Area is the amount of space inside a two-dimensional shape. It is measured in square units such as square inches, square centimeters, or square feet. Perimeter is the distance around a two-dimensional shape. It is measured in linear units such as inches, centimeters, or feet.

instruction: Write a story about Anakin Skywalker encountering a Jedi who speaks and acts like a 1920s British aristocrat
output:
Anakin Skywalker was a young Jedi Knight in training, on his way to a mission with his master, Obi-Wan Kenobi. As they traveled through the stars, they encountered a strange ship, unlike anything they had seen before. As they approached, they noticed a strange figure inside, dressed in robes and wearing a mask over his face. Anakin couldn't help but stare, as the figure moved with an air of nobility and grace, like a 1920s British aristocrat.
The figure turned and saw Anakin, and smiled. "Why, hello there," he said in a cultured voice. "I am Lord Vader, a Jedi Master of great renown. But you may call me... Count Dooku."
Anakin was taken aback by the sight of this Jedi Master, who spoke and acted like a proper British gent. He had never met someone like this before, and he couldn't help but be intrigued. "Pleased to meet you, Count Dooku," he said, bowing slightly. "I am Anakin Skywalker, and this is my master, Obi-Wan Kenobi."
Dooku nodded in return, his mask hiding his expression. "A pleasure to meet you both. I must confess, I am impressed by your skill, Anakin. You are quite talented for one so young."
Anakin blushed slightly, pleased by the compliment. "Thank you, my lord," he replied. "If you don't mind me asking, what brings you to these parts?"
Dooku waved a hand dismissively. "Oh, just traveling from one place to another. I find it helps clear my mind, you know? It's quite relaxing, really."
Obi-Wan cleared his

instruction: what are the possible performance issues in a learning program on cross cultural communication
output:
I have a learning program on cross cultural communication. It has two videos, one is about cultural values of India and another one is about cultural values of Mexico. The participants of the program are from USA. What are the possible performance issues in such a learning program?
The concept of cultural values is very subjective as each individual might interpret it differently. For example, while for some honesty might be a valued quality, for others it might be modesty. Hence, there is a possibility that learners may not relate to certain cultural values presented in the video, thereby leading to a lack of engagement and interest in the program. Additionally, the videos themselves might not be of high quality, which can further negatively impact the learning experience. Finally, the learning program might not address the specific needs or interests of the learners, leading to a lack of relevance and therefore, low motivation.

instruction:
Explain the meaning of the findings from my MRI.  Explain in layman terms.  

FINDINGS:
No restricted diffusion. No acute hemorrhage.

There is a paucity of posterior le periventricular white matter with ex vacuo dilatation of the occipital horn of the le lateral ventricle.

There is moderate-to-severe diffuse cerebral atrophy with concordant prominence of the ventricles.

Mild scattered foci of increased FLAIR signal seen within the periventricular and subcortical white matter. Expected flow voids are noted within the intracranial internal carotid, vertebral and basilar arteries. The cerebellopontine angles and internal auditory canals are unremarkable.

The pituitary gland and midline structures are unremarkable. No discrete pituitary mass, cyst or abnormal enhancement. Bone marrow signal is within normal limits. The orbits and globes are unremarkable. There has been bilateral cataract eye surgery. Mucosal thickening is seen within the right maxillary sinus. The mastoid air cells are unremarkable in signal.

No abnormal enhancement.

No mass effect, midline shift or extraaxial fluid collection.
output: The findings are compatible with the diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease.

instruction:
63-year-old male with diabetes for seven to eight years (BbA1c consistently between 5.9-6.5, fasting blood sugar around 7, other times high between 8-9-9.5, no low blood sugar). CKD for five years (starting with 24-hour urine protein within 200, GFR around 100, but in the last 1-2 years urine protein between 300-400mg, GFR between 60-70, most recent one being 56). No discomfort, not overweight, blood pressure normal, but skin often itches in winter; often constipated year-round.

Current medication: 1. Allisartan Tablets 240mg/day 2. Dapagliflozin Tablets 10mg/day 3. Metformin HCL 500mg*3/day 4. Pancreatic kininogenase enteric-coated Tablets.

Are there any better treatment options and medications available? Avoid or delay dialysis if possible. Are there any other exams that need to be done? What are the recommendations for exercise and diet in addition to medication? When should the above medication be switched to insulin due to CKD?
output: I think you are on good medications for the diabetes and CKD. You may do well for a long time with these. Your A1c is quite good. If low blood sugar becomes a problem, the metformin could be increased or switched to another type of anti-diabetic drug. The pancreatic enzymes should help with your itchy skin (pruritus). The constipation can often be helped by increasing fiber in the diet and making sure you drink enough fluids. It would be helpful to see what your potassium level is and make sure you are not taking in too much.

instruction: Why does warmth make you feel tired?
output:
The body does not absorb iron from food, so it is important to consume a variety of iron-rich foods to get enough of this mineral. A dietary supplement may be necessary for some people. Adult women need 18 milligrams (mg) of iron daily, while adult men need 8 mg. Some good sources of iron include: lean red meat; poultry; fish; dried peas and beans; iron-fortified breads and cereals; and dark green, leafy vegetables.

instruction: Write "Test"
what are five important topics for game design
output:
What are the five important topics for game design?
Author Topic: what are five important topics for game design. (Read 213 times)
What are the five important topics for game design?
While there is no one definitive answer to this question, here are five important areas that game designers should consider when creating a new game:
1. Player Experience: Game designers should focus on creating an enjoyable and immersive experience for the player. This includes elements such as storytelling, character development, and user interface design.
2. Gameplay Mechanics: Game designers should ensure that the game has engaging and challenging gameplay mechanics that keep players coming back for more. This includes elements such as puzzles, combat, and exploration.
3. Graphics and Sound: Game designers should consider the visual and audio elements of the game to create an engaging and immersive experience for the player. This includes elements such as character designs, environments, and sound effects.
4. Replayability: Game designers should create a game with multiple layers of replayability, so that players can continue to enjoy the game even after completing it. This includes elements such as different difficulty settings, hidden secrets, and alternate routes.
5. Marketability: Game designers should consider the marketability of their game and how it will appeal to potential players. This includes elements such as the target audience, marketing strategy, and pricing.

instruction: 2 / 2can you list in bullet points for the role of digital health in preventing the diseases
output:
1) Digital health can provide services such as health education, screening and monitoring to help prevent diseases.
2) It can also facilitate communication between healthcare providers and patients, which can help improve disease prevention efforts.
3) Digital health technologies can enable remote patient monitoring, allowing healthcare providers to track the health status of patients over time and intervene before a disease becomes serious.
4) Digital health can help identify risk factors for diseases, such as unhealthy lifestyle habits, and provide personalized interventions and treatments to address those risks.
5) Digital health can also help to improve access to healthcare services, which can increase the likelihood that individuals will receive preventive care and treatment.

instruction: Who will be the president of South Korea in 2023?
output:
An estimated 16% of South Koreans said they would support President Moon Jae-in for a second term in early April, while 47% said they would vote for opposition leader Ahn Cheol-soo and 25% remained undecided.
The survey was conducted by Gallup Korea from April 1 to 3 on a random sample of 1,003 South Korean adults over the age of 18.
Park Geun-hye was impeached and removed from office in March 2017 after being accused of taking bribes from major businesses, including Samsung, in exchange for political favors.
Moon’s approval rating has remained steady since his inauguration, according to Gallup Korea, but public sentiment is expected to be affected by the upcoming presidential election.

instruction:
Write an article about the site's backlink and its importance"Use the following keywords in the article Questions Others Asked
What is a backlink example?
What are SEO backlinks?
Do backlinks help SEO?
How do I get backlinks?"
output:
Keywords are the backlinks of content
If you haven't already heard, keywords are the new backlinks.
Using keywords as the "backlinks" to your content means using them strategically throughout your content, so that when people search for those keywords in a search engine they will find your content. It can be tempting to over-optimize your content for keywords, but this approach will get you penalized by search engines and won't help you rank highly. Instead, focus on using keywords naturally within your content and creating content that is useful to your audience. The right keywords can help with SEO, but keyword stuffing will not help your site rank higher.

instruction: Why did the building of a pipeline have to be voted on by the government(USA)? Doesn't this infringe on government interfering with private corporations?
output:
Institut Pasteur de la Plateforme Genomique Ide (IPGI) is a non-profit biomedical research foundation whose main mission is to contribute to improving human health by developing innovative technologies and services for the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of diseases. However, the IPGI had to be lobbied by French scientists in order to keep its independence. As a result of this lobbying effort, the French Minister of Research agreed that the IPGI would remain independent from political or industrial control and would not be subject to any public procurement procedures.

instruction:
Simplify "Most of the basic functions of current virtualization software are inherited from this early VM OS. The virtualization software is now represented with the term hypervisor. Hardware virtualization is used to share the resources of the cloud providers effectively with the customers by generating an illusion of dedicated computing, storage, and networking on a computing infrastructure.

The concept of virtualization is physically implemented using the hypervisor modules, and the operation and processing of hypervisors are materialized by the OSS. In other words, hypervisor modules are installed on top of OSS, which act as an interface between hardware units and hypervisor packages."
output: Hypervisor modules are installed on top of OSS, which act as an interface between hardware units and hypervisor packages.

instruction: Write a pitch for a horror movie that plays on the island Sylt in northern germany in the 19th century. Include fishermen and a sinister force that drives the inhabitants insane.
output: A group of fishermen set sail for a regular fishing trip in the coastal waters of Sylt, a popular island destination in Northern Germany. As they venture deeper into the ocean, they encounter an otherworldly force that begins to drive them insane. As the men become increasingly unhinged, their behaviors grow more erratic and violent, leading to a bloody and deadly confrontation with one another. With no hope of escape, the fishermen are doomed to be trapped on the boat with this malevolent entity, driven to commit acts of madness and carnage until there is nothing left of them but eerie whispers and empty shells of their former selves.

instruction: Rewrite the given introductory paragraph so that it starts with a pertinent anecdote. Also rewrite the thesis so that it is succinct and concise:    "Many types of black people have different cultural backgrounds and experiences. For example, African and African American cultures share a common ancestry and history of struggles but have distinct cultural identities. While both groups are considered Black, they have different experiences, records, and cultural practices. As Saint Augustine said, “The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.” This quote emphasizes the importance of exploring other cultures to understand their experiences better. As I have gotten older, I have come to understand the similarities and differences between these two individuals."
output: The two individuals I will be comparing are my grandfather and myself. My grandfather is African, while I am African American. Although we share the same skin color, our cultural backgrounds could not be more different. Growing up in the United States, I was exposed to a completely different set of values, beliefs, and traditions than those of my grandfather who grew up in Africa. As Saint Augustine said, “The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.” This quote emphasizes the importance of exploring other cultures to understand their experiences better. As I have gotten older, I have come to understand the similarities and differences between these two individuals.

instruction: explain TypeScript and Duck Typing

Write up insights from the book Upstream by Dan Heath and the book’s application to a team of Social Workers at Visalia Unified School District that have the following job description:
Under the direction of an assigned supervisor, the School Social Worker will provide school-based mental health services at school sites. The School Social Worker will assess and define problems children may be experiencing with school attendance and performance, family interactions, social problems and school-community relations which interfere with the student’s ability and potential to obtain a satisfactory education; consult and assist parents, teachers and others concerned with the child and his family in planning appropriate strategies for the problem and to assure services are provided according to planned strategy. 
Typical Duties:
1.	Establish with the child and the family a milieu where personal, interpersonal and intrafamilial concerns may be openly shared and discussed.
2.	Consult and collaborate with school personnel to promote a school environment responsive to the needs of children.
3.	Serve as a catalyst to generate, enhance and facilitate the problem-solving process as it affects individuals, groups, institutions and systems.
4.	Serve as an intercessor for students and their family in dealing with community agencies and institutions and with the school system; serve as an intercessor for the school system in dealing with community agencies and institutions.
5.	Conduct mental health and ongoing individual therapy for students
6.	Collect, gather, sort and analyze data about students, parents, and the communities served by the District.
7.	Supervise on-going activities of social work interns from university programs.
8.	Participate in special programs such as the Foster Youth Program as assigned.
9.	Perform related duties as assigned.
Personal Characteristics: 
Should possess the personal characteristics generally recognized as essential for good public employees including integrity, initiative, emotional maturity, dependability, courtesy, good judgment and ability to work cooperatively with others. 
Position Qualifications: 
Knowledge of:   
Effective personal and academic counseling techniques and procedures; counseling theory, ethics and associated legal confidentiality requirements; laws regarding minors and child abuse reporting; applicable sections of the State Education Code and other applicable laws, rules and regulations related to assigned activities; normal and abnormal child behavior and development; behavior modification techniques and strategies; student assistance programs; community referral resources; diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, disability, and ethnic backgrounds of District students; interpersonal skills using tact, patience and courtesy; correct English usage, grammar, spelling, punctuation and vocabulary; record-keeping techniques.
Ability and Skills to: 
Provide counseling and guidance services to students; engage a broad network of partners committed to improving the future of all members of the community; make referrals to other community resources, support groups and social service agencies as appropriate; plan, prepare and conduct individual and group counseling sessions; read, interpret, apply and explain rules, regulations, policies and procedures; maintain current knowledge of program rules, regulations, requirements and restrictions; manipulate and configure data to 
form statistical analysis; set limits and personal boundaries for students; assist with curriculum development; complete work with many interruptions; analyze situations accurately and adopt an effective course of action; work independently with little direction; meet schedules and time lines; work confidentially with discretion; maintain records and prepare various reports, including confidential materials; establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships with others; maintain consistent, punctual and regular attendance; sit or stand for extended periods of time; walk around the campus; lift heavy objects weighing up to 50 pounds; exchange information with others; monitor student behavior. 
Certificate/License/Insurance Requirement:   
Valid California Driver’s License and proof of vehicle insurance required. Licensed as Clinical Social Worker or Associate Clinical Social Worker by the California Board of Behavioral Sciences is preferred. 
Experience:   
One year of experience working with “at-risk” students in an educational or social services setting is desired.   
Education:   
Master of Social Work Degree or PPS credential with master’s degree in a related field required.
output:
Visalia Unified School District is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Maricela Aguilar, MFT Intern
VUSD Social Worker Supervisor

instruction: When I open Anki browser, It shuts down. how can i fix this?
output:
Answer:Sounds like your PC is low on RAM.  You need to delete unneeded programs and files or upgrade the RAM to run Anki.

Comment: I have 8GB of RAM. it doesn't seem to be the problem.

instruction: Why does it feel like less effort to watch 3 - hour long TV episodes back to back than a film?
output:
Observations on the amount of effort expended to watch different media.
I'm currently binging on season 8 of Game of Thrones, watching three episodes back to back. I find it much less tiring than watching a film - I have to expend less effort to keep my attention engaged for each episode and can take breaks if I start losing interest or just want a break. This is unlike watching a film, where I need to give my full attention for the full duration. Am I just lazy, or is there something in the structure of a TV show that makes it easier to watch?

As an experiment, I watched The Shape of Water last night. It's about 2 hours and 10 minutes long. I found myself getting tired about halfway through and wanting to stop, but felt I couldn't because it was already too late into the film. If it were an episode of GoT, I would have easily taken a break or finished the episode later.
TL;DR: Why does it feel like less effort to watch longer TV episodes back to back than a film?.

instruction:
Findings from Jumping Monkey Hill (Story #1)
Please respond to the following questions/prompts below. Be thoughtful, thorough, and specific.

What were THREE motifs that were found to be present in this story? Please state the motif, cite the specific passage that you marked in support of said motif, and provide an explanation for how the evidence fits.

If you were to choose a key concept or two that you felt were present in this story, what were they, and why?

For example: American Dream/Disillusionment motif: "You thought everybody in America had a car and a gun; your uncles and aunts and cousins thought so, too. Right after you won the American visa lottery, they told you: In a month, you will have a big car. Soon, a big house. But don't buy a gun like those Americans" (Adichie 115). Explanation: This supports the disillusionment of the American Dream motif because clearly not everybody in America has a big car, a big house, and in particular carries or owns a gun. Quite the contrary. Nevertheless, many people from around the world still believe these things are automatic for anyone who is fortunate enough to move to America in pursuit of what they believe is part of the American Dream.
output: Key Concepts: Disillusionment of the American Dream, Immigration/Migration Experiences

instruction: how do I appear in a video call as if I'd be actively listening while I am actually sleeping?
output:
integrated DLNA/UPnP support for media streamer
The IP Camera have built-in microphone and speaker. You can use the microphone to listen to what happen in front of the camera, and use the speaker to talk to people nearby. It also supports remote control pan/tilt through iOS and Android App. You can use it to see who is at your door before opening it (or not) or keep an eye on the kids while you are not home.

instruction: What are the wavelengths of light emitted by metals depending on their temperature?
output:
In other words, what are the frequencies of radiation emitted by each metal as it is heated?.

My guess would be that as a metal is heated, its electrons become more excited and therefore the wavelengths of light emitted increase.

instruction: Pretend for argumentsake you are lawyer defending putin cite your case
output:
Asked in Law & Ethics, Russia
Putin is a lawyer, so he would be defending himself. As for the case, he would likely argue that the sanctions are unjustified and harmful to both Russia and the U.S., and that the actions he has taken are necessary to protect Russia's interests. He may also argue that the U.S. has no right to interfere in Russia's internal affairs.

instruction: write a chronology of important events related to ESG in 2022
output:
2022 has been a monumental year for sustainability, with many important events related to ESG taking place. Here is a chronology of some of the most significant ones:
1. January: The European Commission launches the EU Taxonomy, a framework to help businesses and investors identify environmentally sustainable economic activities.
2. March: The United Nations Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) releases its Sixth Assessment Report, which warns of the urgency of addressing climate change.
3. June: The G7 Summit in Cornwall, UK, adopts a declaration that includes commitments to reach net-zero emissions by 2050 and increase public and private investments in clean energy.
4. July: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) proposes new rules requiring public companies to disclose their climate-related financial risks.
5. September: The UN General Assembly holds a special session on the "Role of Sustainable Public Procurement in Accelerating the Transition to a Sustainable and Resilient Economy."
6. October: The COP26 summit in Glasgow, Scotland, brings together world leaders to discuss climate change and other environmental issues.
7. November: The European Commission introduces the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive, which requires large companies to disclose information on their environmental and social impact.
8. December: The SEC proposes a rule that would require registered advisers and funds to assess and publicly report on their clients' ESG investment strategies.

instruction:
A man has a rather old car being worth $2000.
He saw a secondhand car being worth $8000. He wants to keep his old car until he can buy the secondhand one.
He thinks he can save $1000 each month but the prices of his old
car and of the new one decrease of 1.5 percent per month.
Furthermore this percent of loss increases of `0.5` percent
Our man finds it difficult to make all these calculations.
Can you help him?
How many months will it take him to save up enough money to buy the car he wants,
and how much money will he have left over?
output:
A man has a rather old car being worth $2000. He saw a secondhand car being worth $8000. He wants to keep his old car until he can buy the secondhand one.
He thinks he can save $1000 each month but the prices of his old car and of the new one decrease of 1.5 percent per month.
Furthermore this percent of loss increases of `0.5` percent
Our man finds it difficult to make all these calculations.
Can you help him? How many months will it take him to save up enough money to buy the car he wants, and how much money will he have left over?

instruction: 7 / 7Write a detailed patent writing for an innovative and novel way of issuing community tax certificates and other relevant permits and clearances as a digital certificates,  that is non-obvious using verifiable credentials, digital wallet on a blockchain as payment provision, and machine learning. Include claims on detailed processes involved, system architecture and algorithms
output:
Inventors: John Doe, Jane Doe, and Smith Doe
Title: "A Novel System for Issuing Community Tax Certificates and Other Relevant Permits Using Digital Credentials"
Abstract: The present invention relates to a system and method for issuing community tax certificates and other relevant permits using digital credentials. The system comprises a verifiable credential wallet, a blockchain-based platform, and a machine learning algorithm. 
The verifiable credential wallet is used to store and manage digital credentials issued by various authorities. These digital credentials can include community tax certificates, driver's licenses, passports, and other relevant permits. The wallet is designed to be secure and tamper-resistant, ensuring that only authorized individuals can access and use the digital credentials.
The blockchain-based platform is used to store and manage the verifiable credentials issued by the system. The platform uses a distributed ledger technology to ensure that all transactions are transparent, secure, and immutable. This also eliminates the need for intermediaries such as banks or government agencies, reducing transaction costs and improving efficiency.
The machine learning algorithm is used to analyze data from the platform and generate insights into user behavior and trends. This helps to identify fraudulent activities, improve the issuance of digital credentials, and provide personalized services to users.
The present invention provides a novel solution for issuing community tax certificates and other relevant permits using digital credentials. The use of a verifiable credential wallet, blockchain-based platform, and machine learning algorithm ensures that the system is secure, efficient, and transparent. It also provides a convenient and user-friendly way for individuals to manage their digital credentials and access services.
